    • Method Detail

      • maxValueForCapacity2

        public static int maxValueForCapacity2​(int[] values,
                                       int[] weights,
                                       int[] quantities,
                                       int capacity)
        find maximum value from summing the values associated with bounded quantities of weights that sum to LEQ to capacity. 
        runtime complexity is O(n*capacity*max(quantities) where n = weights.length
     space complexity is O(capacity).
        Parameters:
        values - values for items. values and weights describe the same items.
        weights - non-negative array of weights for items
        the - non-negative quantities of each item available.
        capacity - upper limit to the sum of weights for bounded quantities of items
        Returns:

      • maxValueForCapacity

        public static int maxValueForCapacity​(int[] values,
                                      int[] weights,
                                      int[] quantities,
                                      int capacity)

      • maxValueForTarget

        public static int maxValueForTarget​(int[] values,
                                    int[] weights,
                                    int[] quantities,
                                    int target)
        find maximum value from summing the values associated with bounded quantities of weights that sum to exactly EQ target. For best results, items should be in ascending order by weights. 
        runtime complexity is O(n*capacity*max(quantities) where n = weights.length
     space complexity is O(capacity).
        Parameters:
        values - values for items. values and weights describe the same items.
        weights - non-negative array of weights for items
        quantities -
        target - the exact sum that a combination of an unbounded number of weights should sum to
        Returns:

      • numberOfSequencesForTarget

        public static long numberOfSequencesForTarget​(int[] weights,
                                              int[] quantities,
                                              int target)
        count the number of ways that a combination of an unbounded quantity of weights can sum up to exactly EQ target, where the sequences are counted rather than sets, e.g. [1,2] is counted and [2,1] is counted, though [1,1] is counted once.
        Parameters:
        target - the exact sum that a combination of and unbounded quantity of weights should sum to
        weights - non-negative array of item weights
        Returns:
